evs.data.fileio
Class FileIO

java.lang.Object
  evs.data.fileio.FileIO
Direct Known Subclasses:
ASCIIFileIO, NetCDFFileIO, OHDFileIO, PairedFileIO, ProjectFileIO, PublishedInterfaceXMLIO, ResultFileIO
public abstract class FileIO
extends java.lang.Object

Base class for file reading and writing files.

Version:
4.0
Author:
evs@hydrosolved.com

getSupportedForecastFileTypes

public static java.lang.String[] getSupportedForecastFileTypes(boolean describe)
Returns the extensions of supported forecast file types as a String array. Optionally, a description is returned with the file extension.

Parameters:
describe - is true to return a description
Returns:
an array of supported file extensions

Returns:
an array of supported file extensions

isAllMissing

public static boolean isAllMissing(double[] data,
                                   double nV)
Returns true if all inputs in the 1D array correspond to the missing value, false otherwise. TODO: replace calls to this method with FunctionLibrary.isAll(evs.utilities.mathutil.DoubleProcedure)

Parameters:
nV - the missing value
Returns:
true if all inputs are missing

getFileTypeIDForString

public static int getFileTypeIDForString(java.lang.String type)
                                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns an integer file type identifier for the input string. Supported file type strings are: 1. ASCII 2. PI-XML 3. NetCDF 4. NWS-CARD 5. NWS-CS-BINARY Throws an exception if the input string is not recognized.

Parameters:
type - the file type string
Returns:
the identifier for the input string
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

getFileTypeStringForID

public static java.lang.String getFileTypeStringForID(int id)
                                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
Returns a string file type for the input identifier. Supported identifiers are: 1. {#ASCII} 2. {#PIXML} 3. {#NETCDF} 4. {#NWSCARD} 5. {#NWSBIN} Throws an exception if the input identifier is not one of these.

Parameters:
id - the file type identifier
Returns:
the string representation of the identifier
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

getStringArray

protected static java.lang.String[] getStringArray(java.lang.String strings,
                                                   java.lang.String sep)
Attempts to return an array of string values from a string of individual string values separated by the specified separator. Returns the null identifier if the input string corresponds to the null string (case insensitive "null").

Parameters:
strings - the input string
Returns:
a String array

getDoubleArrayString

                                                       int precision)
Returns a string of doubles separated by commas from the input array. Writes with a specified decimal precision.

Parameters:
input - the input array
precision - the number of decimal places to write

parseVarVal

protected static java.lang.Object parseVarVal(java.lang.String type,
                                              java.io.BufferedReader in,
                                              java.lang.String delimiters,
                                              java.lang.String variableName)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
This function expects 2 tokens on a separate line. It checks if the first token equals the string VariableName. In that case it returns the next token which is the value. Example: in file is the line Function call is: String a_string = parseVarVal(buf_in, ", \t\n\r\f", "AttName"); a_string will now contain "Rainfall"

Parameters:
type - the data type to return
in - a buffered reader
delimiters - the file delimiters
variableName - the name of the variable
Throws:
java.io.IOException
